content.question: A student designs an experiment to verify dependence of the mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of an object attached to a spring, on the period <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for an oscillating vertical spring-object system. The student attaches a hanger to a spring, places weights on the hanger, pulls the hanger down, releases it from rest, and measures the corresponding period of oscillation for the hanger. However, during data entry, the student neglects to add the mass of the hanger to the values of the attached masses for the spring. The student constructs a graph of the data to determine if the data agrees with the equation <math alttext="T equals 2 pi times the square root of the fraction m over k" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>,where <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> equals the elastic constant of spring. Which of the following graphs best represents the student’s recorded data?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph of a line in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled m, the vertical axis is labeled T, and the origin O. The line begins on the vertical axis slightly above the origin and it moves upward and to the right at a constant rate.

The figure presents a graph of a line in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled m, the vertical axis is labeled T, and the origin O. The line begins on the horizontal axis slightly to the right of the origin and moves upward and to the right at a constant rate.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled m, the vertical axis is labeled T, and the origin O. The curve begins on the vertical axis slightly above the origin. The curve moves upward and to the right with a decreasing rate as it becomes almost horizontal.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled m, the vertical axis is labeled T, and the origin O. The curve begins on the horizontal axis slightly to the right of the vertical axis. The curve moves upward and to the right with an increasing rate as it curves away from the horizontal axis.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled m, the vertical axis is labeled T, and the origin O. The curve begins on the vertical axis slightly above the horizontal axis. The curve moves upward and to the right with an increasing rate as it curves away from the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled m, the vertical axis is labeled T, and the origin O. The curve begins on the vertical axis slightly above the origin. The curve moves upward and to the right with a decreasing rate as it becomes almost horizontal.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
